Service Details: - Provides programs and housing services within the fields of community justice, social services, and health that include several employment readiness and training services, outreach services, criminal justice alternatives and restorative justice- Additional services include (but are not limited to): supportive facilities offering housing services that assist individuals to gain greater independence and an FASD mentoring and outreach program for individuals diagnosed or suspected of having FASD who struggle to live independently- Our social enterprise cafe--One Cup at a Time--provides hands-on, paid employment and experience to individuals who identify as having a disability- Provides education on prostitution and related issues to sex trade consumers- Provides drop-in services that include harm reduction supplies, recreation passes, shoebank vouchers, referrals, support, and direction- Reviews, evaluates and advocates for changes in the criminal justice process, engages in public education on matters relating to criminal law and its application, and promotes crime prevention through community and social development activities
How to Apply: See individual program and services records for specifics
